reviewText: Ever play a game in the Thief" series? This is what you get when someone decides to make a Thief game with RPG Maker and it's a fun experience.\n\nNo combat
hoursPlayed: hiding in crates and closets while observing the guards patrol patterns and waiting for the right opening to make your move. Get spotted even once and you have to restart from the last checkpoint but since every room you enter is a checkpoint this is not an issue and the game maintains a quick pace.\n\nGraphically
voteText: other than the main character's sprite
helpfulPercent: the game seems to use default RPG maker assets. If you ever played an RPG Maker game you know how this looks and controls.  Nonetheless visual design is clean. Everything is laid out well
votesHelpful: for the most part it's clear where you can hide and important details like treasures to pick up or entrances to secret passages are clearly visible. There is also a minimal but decent story about the character trying to sabotage war preparations
votesTotal: it does the job providing some context on the missions and the character's motivations.\n\nOn the negative side there are odd spelling errors here and there. Controls are solid but they have some quirks that could have been ironed out (my main gripe is how you have to be completely still to crouch or get up from the crouching position) and early on it requires some trial and error to figure out how the enemies field of vision works. Also keep in mind the game is extremely linear
votesFunny: each room/screen has one solution/route you have to figure out so it's best to get into it knowing each mission is a series of connected stealth/timing puzzles rather than expecting an "open" stealth game.\n\nIn conclusion this is a neat little indie title well worht it's full (low) prize. If you're a fan of stealth games and don't specifically dislike RPG Maker games this should earn a cozy spot in your wishlist and hopefully your library. Heartily recommended."

reviewText:
Yes another RPG Maker game...

Here is my quick look video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AieoBV7On-4

But this one is pretty well done and has the unique aspect of trying to use stealth and shadows to sneak through halls and rooms unseen.  It's actually quite fun and makes it feel and play a little different then all of the other RPG Maker games I've played.

There are a few mis-spelled words now and then, but it doesn't detract much from the game.  My biggest gripe in the time I've played the game so far is that the escape key doesn't work at all, and I was forced to CTRL-ALT-DEL to manually abort the game.  The game saves automatically, but still the ESC key should work as a method of escaping the game.

These are pretty minor gripes, and I think people who enjoy these classic RPG style games will be very happy with this entry on Steam, especially at it's low price point of $3.99 USD.  Catch this game on sale, and it's even a better value.

If you are the type that doesn't usually enjoy these kind of RPG Maker games, then the unique steath aspect of the game will not likely make it fun for you, so I'd caution against buying it just for that aspect alone.

Grading this game on what I've played of the game.. I'd give it a 7 out of a possible 10.  Recommended for people who enjoy these classic RPG sort of games, and not recommended for people who enjoy fancier/pretty RPGs or more action oriented games.

reviewText: Short but nice experience (~2 hrs). Very much a light Thief-inspired game. detection range of enemies are vague but easy enough to work around. I appriciate the quick reload because getting caught will happen (especially around dogs). I only wish there was better navigation on the larger maps and would appriciate a way to replay chapters without going through the story again. I enjoyed the snow camp level the most.

reviewText:
IntroductionLadra is a stealth action adventure that tests your abilities as the ultimate thief. Find secret passages and tunnels to stay out of sight. Use the shadows, your speed and intelligence to always be one step ahead.

Points of interest +Gameplay is very unique for an RPG maker game

+Stealth mechanics are well made, but hard to master

+The price is right! A fantastic buy for $4 or on sale

-Currently, no achievments or trading cards. This may turn some people off to the game, but then again, they may add these features in the future.

-This game definetly requires a certain taste to play. If you enjoy traditional RPGs, then you will have a blast with this game. If not, I would be careful when buying this.
In summary...A great buy at regular price or on sale. Perfect game for traditional RPG fans, but not quite ideal for those who dislike these types of games. Well made game with very interesting stealth mechanics, a worthy buy!
I would give this game a 7 out of 10

reviewText:
Fun little old school zelda-rpg like stealth game.

-So far mostly hide in shadows/stealth.
-Graphics are basic but decent.
-Lots of save points (basically each room)
-Gamepad support, although had a couple small issues.
-Reasonably priced.
Only downside is that it plays in a small screen window.

reviewText:
Ladra is a good stealth game, where you have to be careful, make no mistake even one step!
The game was created with RPG Maker, with gameplay really very solid and innovative!
In short, a really interesting game is different" which is worth a try!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sIJb1bDaY5g
(Below is the Italian full review)
Ladra è un gioco basato sulla furtività (Stealth).
Dove bisogna nascondersi ed utilizzare l'intelligenza per essere sempre un passo avanti!


Feature:
-Nascondi te stesso: nasconditi nei posti più oscuri per non essere visto
-Rimanere inosservato: utilizza le ombre per non farti notare
-Bottino: esplora i livelli per trovare tutti i tesori nascosti
-Ruba: ruba alle guardie per ottenere oggenti importanti
-Passaggi segreti: cerca passaggi segreti che ti permettono di trovare nuove strade e nuovi tesori
-Supporto completo al gamepad

Parere Personale:
Ladra è un buon gioco Stealth

reviewText: I cannot progress at all in this game, due to a bug in the very beginning of the game where a guard that previously moved around, stops in the middle of the room after getting the main tressure. I mean, I don't know what I expected from a game I got for $0.59, but I hope it gets fixed, this looks interesting enough. ;)

Bug within first 10 minutes prevents further progression with guards blocking all possible escape routes. As it currently is right now, I can't recommend it for any price. This issue needs to be fixed first.
